page.title: 14Seasons in Bourtie/Keithall
page.content: Much land in bourtie and Keithall/Kinkell lies above 500 feet and weather conditions follow a similar outline on extremes. Farmers have to use the seasons to their advantage. Most ploughing is carried out in Autumn, immediately after harvest, when winter grain is sown. From mid-Novemer most of the high ground is permanently white and the only operation which can be carried out is much sprading (platterring liquid manure) on ground which may grow grass or be ploughed the following season. Around mid-april the weather is open enough to bring out cattle, but often spring seed is not sown until May when the land is farmer. After hay and silage are cut in June, sheep and cattle are moved into the cut fields from earlier pastures.
